name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Love this place for winter camping. Their host system is great and can be a life saver. The staff are all very friend and easy to talk to. Lots to see and do here. The hockey rink makes for fun day time game. There is a fair amount of ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review:
Went Dec 18-21 and the park was beautiful. Went with a bunch of friends to hike and photo shoot and we were more than impressed with the trails. There was a good number of them too. A few paths were closed but we still had a great time.
Bonus: wildlife are not afraid to interact with you.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: We love Mew Lake in the winter.  Thank you to Harvey Cornell for always going that extra mile to make the park such a wonderful place to be.  And thanks for always making that rink so amazing for the Hockey players and skaters.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
user: Snowy Owl Travel & Entertainment Group Toronto
review: Mew Lake campground is located in the middle of Highway Corridor 60 in Algonquin Park, just before the Lake of Two Rivers Store. The campground is relatively small and beautiful. Some of the campsites have a very beautiful waterfront ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: I went to the skating rink on a Sunday afternoon and nobody was there. The skating rink was in perfect condition and there was also a little fire going with a warm up tent. I didn't stay overnight but I did see a few people that had ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Great in all seasons, winter time is a must to experience the ice rink alongside the fire pit. Bring hot dogs and marshmallows for roasting along with skates.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review:
Awesome place! The campground is well maintained and clean. Flush toilets and showers make it an easy sell for those not really into the back country style camping. 
The beach was a nice soft sand bottom with nice clear water. For the ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Mew Lake Campground was reasonably priced and had beautiful pine trees, lakes and scenery.  The amenities were good for being in the wilderness.  Our cell phones and data worked, had satellite TV to get FOX news and had electric. ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: There has a lovely skating link. A delightful and well-managed clean campground is made us feel happy

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Great Facility! This would be a great way to introduce someone to Algonquin camping! You can rough it if you like but there are amenities (showers, toilets and fresh water) to make it easy.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Good average campground in the park. One of the best campgrounds if you are pulling a large trailer and need a larger site.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: We have been trying out different camp ground in Algonquin Provincial Park this past 5 years and we liked Mew Lake Campground the best so far. It located about the middle of highway 60 corridor so is easy to access to both east and west ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Great camp ground. Got a site by the lake with plenty of room enough for 2-3 families. Beautiful during the Fall season.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Just peaceful beautiful place always happy to go back there

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review:
Wonderful place to camp in the winter time. (Havent camped here in the summer yet) 
The public hot tent, fire pit and ice rink is amazing and so much fun! 
And they had hot water for showers still! 
Overall such a great experience ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Thank-you. Nice staff. Nice campground.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Now if I had the new Yurt the review would get a 5. The older Yurts are still comfortable and warm but the are outdated. However they are warmer than a tent. The Yurt has electric heating which is sufficient for even the coldest nights. ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: This is only the second campground I have stayed at in Algonquin Park. There is a good sized beach on the small lake. It is pretty close to the highway, so I found it a little noisy with road traffic. Will try a different campground for my next visit.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Absolute heaven! Only been here 2 days so far but loving every moment. Site and showers are clean. Walked a couple of close trails and the views are awesome.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: After camping at Ontario Parks for most of my life, we finally camped at an Algonquin park campsite.  We got a pretty nice site at Mew Lake campground last minute leading up to Labor Day weekend.  Must have been a cancellation!|The sites ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: I love yurt camping and this time we saw moose, wild turkey and fox.  Going back again in February and March.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: This campsite is much warmer than Lake of Two Rivers which is nice for fall. Likely because the trees are much smaller. Downside, the beach does not allow dogs, & there is no dog beach, although the map says there is. The sites are a ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Great campsite with a beautiful view of the lake! Campsite #93. Make sure to bring bug spray and a good camera! Launch your canoe right off the site. One more word of advice get gas and any tobacco products before you hit Algonquin park or you'll have to drive back!!

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Great campground, nice sandy beach, and the added bonus of a shower station and washrooms! Only suggestion I have, please stop letting people pick all the berries in the field and leaving none for the bears. Bears are now stealing food ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: It's absolutely bizarre why this campground is situated right next to the highway where the motorcycles and trucks are loud all day and all night.  I don't understand why this campground hasn't been relocated farther away from the highway ages ago...  I guess there's only 7,653 km¬≤ of park.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Great place to bring the family, friends or even just yourself. The campground is connected to both hiking and biking trails that lead to beautiful scenery. The facilities are in good shape and all the camping lots are well maintained. If you‚Äôre looking for a weekend in a developed campground, choose Mew Lake.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Have been camping here since I was a kid. we bring our children here every year now and always look forward to it. It has a great atmosphere, the staff are great and so are the campers.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Nice campground very taken care of. However if you plan to be up longer than 10pm beware you will get complaints and visits from camp wardens lmfao. All in all a nice spot.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Visited in off season and were delighted with the site, campground and Algonquin in general. We loved Bartlett lodge for a nice dinner while roughing it. The only issue we had was people let the dogs swim at the people beach.|

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review:
If you are COLORED person, make sure you stay AWAY from PARK RANGERS. They will HARASS you at every turn. It was horrible experience interacting with park employees. They are RACIST. 

I felt that employees think that CANADA and parks ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Great campground when run by Ontario Parks.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Did not enjoy this campground at all. Even though it's in a very large provincial park many of the campsites are so close to the road that you can hear traffic from your tent, I wasn't really impressed by the lake itself either and the "quiet zone" we stayed in still had people playing radio, bringing dogs etc.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Nice campground.  Hydro sites are large.  Comfort station is old and needs to be replaced. Somewhat noisey close to Hwy 60.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Feel little crowded but beautiful place.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Mew Lake Campground did not disappoint! Being in the radio-free section made it easy to forget how close we were to the highway. Though the lake is small, it is wonderfully serene and quite close to several trails. Would definitely visit again, though ideally when the weather is warmer!

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review:
Mew Lake is the classic mixed used front country campground.

-It's open year round.
-The spots are almost all big enough to park a pop up camper in (if not much bigger).
-The privacy is fair with a slight amount of tree cover between ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Try to get a campsite in the 93-97 sections on the lake for the best views and lots of privacy.  Despite it being in season camping time we were unable to get firewood anywhere but the front gates (despite signs indicating we should go ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review:
This is worst camp ground I have seen in Ontario. Dirty and smelly washrooms. When I gave feedback to the camp office, they told me that it's luxury camping. If you don't like it, you can leave it any time.

Camp sites and Walkways camp sites are littered with garbage.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: It is right next to the washroom and the pond.  As others have mentioned, it is very close to the highway, so traffic noises should be expected.  The site is private, pretty large and can easily park 3 cars.  There are lots of good spots ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: 3 girlfriends and I wanted to winter camp in a yurt and dogsled. It was all better than we expected. The "hosts" on site were great to deal with. Beautiful area to visit. Recommend dog sledding at Northridge Ranch in Huntsville. Dogs are very well treated.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Beautiful campground with lovely trails.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Nicer, much more private sites than LO2R. Still close to store, restaurant and bike rental shop. Lake is very small though.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Fantastic spot winter or summer

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Excellent campground with a private beach good placement in the park as well!

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Great that it's Algonquin. Lots of wild life. Small campground with not much privacy

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: We had a great stay in mid-June 2018 at the campground.  We were on holiday from London UK and wanted to get in to nature.  Yurt 49 is right on the Lake which afforded a terrific view of the sunsets and a peaceful ambiance.  The Yurt was ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Been coming here now 4 years every Canada day week till the next weekend love it nice park no robo cop kids in there bulletproof vest coming up to your fire when your just sitting talking telling you to keep it down definitely a vary decent park nice beach lots to do around and in the park

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Really nice to have a separate no radio/dog free area. Lake is beautiful but i dont recommend swimming in it. Fyi theres only 1 public washroom in the whole campground, but there are outposts. Lots of different kinds of birds and chipmunks around. We enjoyed our stay!

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: rustic and charming.  i would avoid any odd house, they stick.  the communal center is often cleaned and maintained.  this is a big plus.  nice trails.  friendly people.  surrounding camps have a diverse list of activities.  will definitely go back.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Great place to get away from it all showers and laundry facilities on site friendly staff open in winter too for the adventurous type

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: The water was amazing and I saw that there were camp signs right by the water saw plenty of people canoeing swimming and fishing

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review:
Dirty washrooms where taps not functioning and toilets are clogged even after telling park people few times. Bathrooms are never cleaned and too much gunk inside. 

I saw people drinking in bathroom area two nights in a row. I told the ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: I'm not a fan of car camping but this is a.good campground.  I use it as a jump off.to the interior if I arrive too late to hit the trails

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: This site is really nice. It's right on the water with easy canoe access right from your site. There's ample space for parking, a dining area, seating area, and sleeping area. The site is pretty private too. The comfort stations were ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Great park. Great trails for byke and walking

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Relaxing great trails, wild life galore saw moose and calf.  Yurt Camping is easy in the snow and melting snow

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Great area. A lot of trails close to Campground. Clean and altogether enjoyable.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: This is my favourite place, get your own.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Our family loves this campground! The bathrooms are clean, showers have nice, hot water and the hospitality station is great too! It's fairly central to most hiking trails which is a bonus.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Great camp site. Quite and peaceful. Right by water.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Our family recently stayed at Mew Lake in Algonquin. We had a non-Hydro, lake-front site, and it was everything we had hoped. Kids could swim directly off the campsite, while also seeing wildlife directly from our site. Each morning ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Stayed at Mew lake for the May long weekend. First time at this campground as we prefer more private sites. However we wanted electric because it was so cold we needed to run the heater. There are more private beautiful sites in the ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Nice campsites with good lake access and decent privacy. Only drawback is that the highway is right across the lake and is fairly loud.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Was told by the park help I had to wait until 8am to check out before I could leave as I arrived late. I had planned to be on the road by 6:30. Waited until 8:30 by the time they got the computers going for them to ask me my site # and say thanks have a nice day. Will not use again if I cannot arrive before 7pm

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Amazing!! Little too close to highwa

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Damn good site... but the shower room water is way too hot...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Loved the campground. Roomy sites, clean comfort station and courteous staff!

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: People were great,lake close by.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: The annual place to camp during the  winter season.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: love the gonk!

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Beautiful campground. The radio free zone is always my favourite area to camp. The little lake is so nice to way up to.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Excellent place for all ages

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: We make a yearly visit to this campground. We also enjoy renting the Yurts in the winter for a family camp out.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Normally I tent even in winter but this time chose to sleep in a Yurt. Reservations were easy to do online. |The campsite has a heated washroom with a shower. The skating rink was in good condition and staff friendly at east gate. With ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: This is a beautiful campground. We saw a family of ducks. My cousin saw a moose and another camper saw a beaver. We stayed at 114 in the radio and dog free zone. The frog symphony played us to sleep. The beach is lovely. Wish it had brought my paddle board.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Love this park. Park staff and host, Tom we so helpful.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: We had a great weekend at Mew Lake! Huge site, clean washrooms, warm showers, great location (close to bike trail and Two Rivers Store). We even saw a moose driving out of the campground! ||Just a few minor frustrations -|We arrived ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: The perfect place to go winter camping, especially if you have kids. Heated washrooms, running water, a community ice rink and warming tent are all available at Mew Lake.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review:
Great for car camping, great sites and some sites are off of mew lake. 

Washrooms are a little outdated. great site overall

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Very well looked after. A bit close to the highway though.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: A great place for a winter getaway.  This campground has a warm comfort station,  gorgeous views, and a skating rink for lots of winter fun. We had a quiet spot without many campers around, but we could hear people across the lake. Come prepared with fire starters though because the wood from the park store is damp.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Great clean park

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Always loved this place!

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Great place.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Beautiful layout, easy to register and get into. No issues whatsoever.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Our favorite Algonquin camping site!. The dog and radio free area offers very secluded sites. Much quieter than the other nearby campgrounds. It is about 10 minutes by bike along a beautiful wooded trail to get to the main camp store. Mew lake has a nice beach area and access to the railway walking/cycling trail.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Enjoyed the dog and radio free area with it's secluded sites. While the park has sites with electricity they are not within this area and are not nearly as secluded. If you can live without electricity and do not have pets this is great place to visit.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Really nice camp sites on he water, but mine was too close to the highway so the road noise was a bit loud.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Algonquin is a beautiful gem. Mew Lake is an excellent spot for car camping and has beautiful views. Only downfall is it is too close to highway 60'and there is road noise.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Nice campgrounds. Water is cold in the lake.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: We went family day weekend, I was surprised with just  how many people camp in the winter.  And they were having  a whole winter festival in too.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review:
Mew Lake Campground is a pretty nice spot.  
Choose your site wisely because there are wide variety.
My spot on this stay was across the lake from the Highway so there was a lot of traffic noise into the early evening.
Otherwise, the ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Nice site (107) with a view of the water, but too close to the highway for our preferences. ... This campground is absolutely magical in Winter though (stayed in one of the yurts in February)

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Huge sites and the campground was beautiful

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: We travelled in late June with an RV.  We had a serviced site with Electricity only for 2 night .  The washrooms were a bit of a hike but they were clean.  I found the shower really hot and couldn't adjust the temperature.  The bugs were ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Quite, beautiful, lots of empty camping areas

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Too much mosquitoes

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Great camping. Large lots. Good showers.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Enjoyed a winter weekend in one of the yurts. Loved it - great for cross-country skiing, outdoor cooking over a fire and there was even a skating rink. Heater in the yurt was great, but it struggled to fight the cold outside (below -25 Celcius overnight) so be prepared with lots of warm gear!

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Great time winter camping.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: good place

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Large sites, quiet in winter, heated comfort stations.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Open all year round

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Nice for camping. We recommend a yurt.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Mew Lake Campground keeps one electric sector open all year around. It is relatively small and cozy. Most of the sites have good size.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Summer or winter it's a great campground.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: We stayed in yurt 49 from the end of May to early June - it was a mid-week visit so not overly busy, but as our yurt backed on to the water, it was still busy where we were located and had neighbours on either side. The yurt and ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Beautiful lake.. A bit close to highway

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Great for winter hikes.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: The only campground open year round as their comfort stations are winterized. Not as quiet as I had expected. Hosts were very friendly and helpful. Honor system for firewood is very good.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Great place to camp if you like wildlife.  There's usually a warning about black bears in the area.  Some of the people who camp here leave a lot of garbage and have little respect for other campers though.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: really wonderful and quiet place. Especially nice to see in the fall when the colours change. TONS of great trails nearby too

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Was covered in ice and no salt options available in the camp ground

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Mew Lake Campground is, as far as I know, the only winter campground  at Algonquin.||The facilities are excellent an include heated washrooms, hot showers, and washers and dryers. The laundry room is also an excellent source for warm ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Great experience here. Clean fresh air, with water on all  3 sides. The ground is very soft for the tent peg to go in.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: I survived - 47C with wind chill in a hot tent, and got to see a woodpecker to boot!

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: We stayed here during the winter months while doing some backpacking(day trips).  Location is perfect and the wolves at night howling put us to sleep every night.  The sites are spacious and some right on the water.  You can also pick up ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Fantastic visitor center. The viewpoints are amazing fore wildlife. Especially in winter,

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Great camping site, small, but private. The only issue is that being close to the highway, you can hear the occasional truck at night, other than that, this has been my favourite camp site so far.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Beautiful spring ;)

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: It was a decent campground. Not very large in size. We camped in the radio free, dog free zone. The site we had was nice, had a slight view of the lake. You could hear the highway traffic from our sight. Not super noticable though, but ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Mew lake offers section w/o pets and radios with most of the sites right on the lake's shore. All these are nice and quiet with enough space between sites to have a feeling of privacy. The only drawback is that the common rooms (with showers) are quite far and you'll probably end up driving your car to get into shower :)

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Beautiful campground

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review:
Excellent camp.
Lots of animals, a lake and in a fantastic location.
Hot showers and proper bathrooms etc.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: We camped here from May 8 to 12, 2016. We were on site 51 with a 32 ft. fifth wheel. The site was beautiful, right on the lake. Easy to back into, and fairly level. The weather was nice, but still pretty cold. We had to wear winter coats ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: A beautiful and affordable campsite on the lakeshore, close to several hiking trails and a short drive from the Algonquin Visitor's Centre. Beach nearby

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Great place. Well looked after. Great people.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: I've been to Mew Lake a few times, and each time it's a great experience. Try to get site 96 or 97, they're great!

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: We came here to take our 7 year old skating. She is learning to skate and this was a great place to practice. Would love to come back here and try winter camping. There were hockey nets and the park staff were helpful

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Beautiful area and a great campground.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: I went to Mew Lake in late September 2014 and had absolutely perfect weather! It had been cold at night and very warm during the day for about a week before going. Because of the conditions their was no bugs and it was absolutely ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: We spent Canada Day weekend at Mew Lake. Just awesome place!!!!||It was rainy and a bit cold - but we did enjoyed it anyway.||We did kayaking, biking and even fishing!||The nature is very beautiful and the air is fresh and full of ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Campsites around 119 can see and hear wild cars roaming around highway 60.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Quite and peaceful but a lot of Mosquitoes !

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: We spent 4 days at Mew Lake our site was right across road from the hosts , this was quite helpful for-sure. We day hikes on all the trails we could get to and the scenery was fabulous . We are already making plans for next year

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: I stayed here may 2/4 weekend and in lot 101 which is part of the radio free/dog free area. I enjoyed the lot. It was spacious and everyone was generally quiet throughout the campground. The bathrooms close to the site are outhouse style ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: I love this place. We go throughout the summer and bathe in the fields of blueberries as we watch bears wander past in the distance and then in October we bring the kids there to camp and trick or treat.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: We were three complete newbie families, booked 2 sites at Mew Lake with no idea what to expect.  The sites at this location were huge - could easily accommodate 3 tents per site, plus vehicles.  Or, you know, 1 monster RV.  Our sites ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: This is a nice clean campground. Mew lake is on the smaller side and is right off Route 60 so I would recommend booking a site away from the road as the car traffic may be bothersome. We booked a yurt on site 49. It sits right off the ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Amazing time in the fall. So many colours. Truly breathtaking

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: The usual experience

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Great access to trails,and bike trail.  Few nice sites with some privacy

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: What a gorgeous park! Our site was right on the water. We could canoe right off of our site which was fantastic. You are closer to the highway than some of the other parks in Algonquin but the noise really is not that bad at all. The odd ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Came here for a party, left satisfied and happy. The park is beautiful along with lake.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Stayed in yurt number 65 with our daughter who is 14 months old. This yurt is right on the water which is nice and it is right beside the beach. The beach isn't what we expected... not a lot of sand, it's more grass but it's still a nice ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: The campsites are really nice and big with privacy.  We use tents and were in #113 in the no dog/no radio area.  The lake is a bit small for canoeing but it does have a nice beach.  There are lots of trails and a store nearby.  I would do this again!

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: We camped at Mew Lake for two nights while doing a road trip in June and would consider planning a future trip just to go back .  We were in the dog-free radio-free section and had a beautiful view of the lake and as much privacy as one ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Mew lake campground offers a very good location for a families with kids, a beautiful lake, well spaced campsite providing privacy and well appointed comfort station with clean washrooms and showers !. If you stay away from campsites close to HWY 60 (which we didn't) it would be an awesome experience.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: While the campground is located right off of Hwy 60, the noise of the highway wasn't that noticeable at our site (23).  We had easy access to the bike trail - which was fantastic, being able to ride for 12 km on an old railway line to a ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Booked 3 days the weekend after may long weekend. Not many sites filled. On site 113 on end of point in dog free radio free zone. Sloped on entrance to site bit nice flat place to pitch tents. Fire pit had rocks around it and no ring ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Stayed here for two nights in June on site 5. Sites are very large which is nice. Not many people were there so we had lots of privacy. Bugs are bad but not the worst I've seen for this time of year. The beach is nice and we were able to get some great pics of some Canadian Geese with their babies.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Good to sit on the Beach for long time in a deep fall.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: A wonderful family camping trip. We had Yurt #54 and it was great. large lot and close to water/toilet. There is a raspberry bush right beside us and we were picking and eating berries throughout our stay. I also know the the blueberries ...

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: We stayed at Mew Lake Campground from August 29 until September 3, 2015.What a surprise to see a black bear not just once but three times during our stay! A bit scary but what a awesome time and a great story to tell everyone!

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
review: Decent sites but close to highway and as a result is very noisy from the traffic.

name: Algonquin  Mew Lake Campground
